page.title: 01HARES DOWN, KNOWSTONE, Devon
page.content: A link road is soon to be built running through the middle of Hares down. Together with Knowstone Inner and Outer Moors the home of rare plants, animals and birds including barn owl, buzzard , deer, frogs, a "stop over" for migratory birds. The views across Exmoor are breathtaking. The moor contains high rocky parts and many boggy parts 800ft. Where springs rise and drop down the steep hills to small streams at the bottom of the combes. There are decidous woods and copses, and forestry plantation. Pasture land bounded by hedges, some coppiced others neglected or "shaved" by tractor. This area contains 10 farms, with 3 being thatched one is an unspoiled Devon longhouse with 2 ponds the home of flocks of domestic and wild geese and ducks and chickens. In spring will all the bulbs and babcis
